data.title: Familial Adult Myoclonic Epilepsy
data.meta_description: MalaCards integrated disease information for Familial Adult Myoclonic Epilepsy from 75 data sources
data.text: Familial adult myoclonic epilepsy, also known as benign adult familial myoclonic epilepsy (BAFME), is an inherited epileptic syndrome characterized by cortical hand tremors, myoclonic jerks, and occasional generalized or focal seizures. The disease has a non-progressive or very slowly progressive course, with no signs of early dementia or cerebellar ataxia. Symptoms typically manifest in adulthood, with cortical myoclonus presenting as tremulous finger movements and myoclonus of the extremities.
